title: Solutions Architect
description:
Description 

As a Solutions Architect with a strong focus on implementation, you will be responsible for both designing and deploying complex technology solutions to meet the needs of our diverse client base. Your role will be critical in bridging the gap between the conceptual architecture and the actual implementation of technology solutions. In this unique position, you will spend approximately 60% of your time on hands-on implementation activities, such as system configuration, cloud deployment, and integration tasks. You'll work closely with clients to understand their business requirements, constraints, and current technological landscape. Leveraging this understanding, you will architect solutions that not only meet but exceed client expectations, considering scalability, reliability, and cost-efficiency. Given the heavier implementation focus, you'll often find yourself transitioning seamlessly from a design meeting to configuring network protocols, setting up cloud-based services, or troubleshooting deployed solutions. Your deep technical expertise, along with your exceptional communication skills, will enable you to articulate the benefits and nuances of your architectural decisions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. As a valuable member of our team, you will not only contribute to the successful delivery of solutions but also play a key role in mentoring junior staff and leading by example. This role demands a high level of technical competency, a deep understanding of various technologies and platforms, and an aptitude for implementing and optimizing solutions in real-world environments. If you are passionate about technology and thrive in a fast-paced, client-oriented setting, this could be the role for you. Key Responsibilities: 1. Consult with Clients: Understand client needs, business objectives, and existing systems to design effective solutions. 2. Architectural Design: Develop comprehensive architectural plans that serve as blueprints for implementation, considering scalability, security, and cost-efficiency. 3. Hands-On Implementation: Carry out the actual deployment of designed solutions, which could involve setting up servers, configuring networks, or coding custom solutions. 4. Technical Leadership: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior staff members on both design and implementation best practices. 5. Documentation: Maintain thorough documentation for solutions, from architectural diagrams to implementation guides and user manuals. 6. Client Communication: Keep clients informed about project statuses, changes, and requirements. 7. Performance Tuning: Optimize the performance of deployed solutions through monitoring, troubleshooting, and updates. 8. Vendor Relations: Build and maintain relationships with vendors to ensure that solutions are optimized for specific client needs. 9. Quality Assurance: Validate the functionality, performance, and reliability of implemented solutions through rigorous testing procedures. 10. Ongoing Support: Offer technical support and training to clients for implemented solutions as needed. Minimum Requirements: Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field. 1. A minimum of 7-10 years of experience in systems engineering or a closely related field. 2. Proven experience with cloud architecture (Azure or AWS). 3. Demonstrated experience in managing large scale infrastructure deployments or migrations. Certifications: At least one advanced certification from Azure (Azure Solutions Architect, Azure DevOps Engineer, etc.) or AWS (AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional, etc.). VMware Certified Expert (VCDX, VCAP, etc.) Minimum Skills: Technical Skills: Fundamental knowledge in core areas such as virtualization, networking, storage technologies, cloud services, and security. Scripting and Automation: Basic skills in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, or Bash, and familiarity with automation tools. Network Protocols: Advanced understanding of network protocols and services (DNS, HTTP/HTTPS, SNMP, etc.). Problem Solving: Demonstrated ability to analyze and troubleshoot complex technical issues. Communication: Effective communication skills, both written and verbal. Other Requirements: Collaboration Skills: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and coordinate with other departments. Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changes in technology and the business environment. Analytical Thinking: Strong analytical and critical thinking skills for making data-driven decisions. Although there are minimum qualifications for this role, the following outlines the requirements of a Solutions Architect I for training and development in addition to a minimum 24 months in the role before being considered for a higher position. Desired Knowledge and Skills: Technical Expertise: Deep understanding of cloud computing, virtualization, networking, and storage solutions. Problem-Solving: Ability to troubleshoot complex issues, think critically, and come up with effective solutions quickly. Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills for conveying complex technical information clearly. Scripting Languages: Proficiency in one or more scripting languages like Python, PowerShell, or Bash for automation tasks. Vendor-Specific Technologies: Knowledge of products and services offered by key vendors in the technology landscape. Project Management: Although not a core focus, basic understanding of project management principles can be beneficial. Adaptability: Ability to quickly adapt to new technologies and learn on the job. Desired Certifications: 1. Cisco: Routing & Switching: At least one Expert-level certification such as CCIE Routing and Switching, along with an Architect/Design-level certification like CCDA or CCDP. Collaboration: Expert-level certification like CCIE Collaboration, and Design/Architect-level certification like Cisco Certified Design Expert (CCDE) in collaboration. Wireless: Expert-level like CCIE Wireless, and a Design/Architect-level certification like Cisco Certified Design Expert (CCDE) in wireless. NAC Solutions: Specialized training and/or certification in Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) is highly recommended. 2. Aruba: Expert-level certification like Aruba Certified Mobility Expert (ACMX) and an Architect/Design-level certification like Aruba Certified Design Expert (ACDX). Wireless: Aruba Certified ClearPass Expert (ACCX) for advanced knowledge in wireless security and access management. NAC Solutions: Training and certification in Aruba ClearPass Policy Manager is strongly recommended. 3. Fortinet: Expert-level certification like NSE 8 (Fortinet Network Security Expert 8), and an Architect/Design-level certification like NSE 7 (Fortinet Network Security Architect). 4. Microsoft: Expert-level certification like Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert and a Design/Architect-level certification like Microsoft Certified: Azure for SAP Workloads Specialty. 5. AWS: Expert-level certification like AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional, and a Design/Architect-level certification like AWS Certified Advanced Networking - Specialty. 6. VMware: Expert-level certification like VMware Certified Design Expert (VCDX), along with a Professional or Advanced Professional level in a specific domain (NV, DCV, etc.). 7. Cybersecurity: High-level cybersecurity certification like CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) or CISM (Certified Information Security Manager). Candidates must possess at least one Expert-level and one Architect/Design-level certification in each of the relevant technology areas for this Solutions Architect role at a VAR. The portfolio should include specializations in areas like collaboration, voice, and wireless, in addition to the core competencies. Additional Information: - Local travel to job sites will be required - Compensation: Our Client offers competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package including and medical, dental and vision; paid vacation and holidays; and a 401K matching program. Our Client is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

 Skills 

Cloud, cyber security, vmware, azure, aws, powershell scripting, python, bash scripting, architecture, cisco routers switches, aruba wireless, fortinet

 Top Skills Details

 Additional Skills & Qualifications 

 Should have certifications and expertise in Architect/Design, infrastructure setup, and configuration, with a focus on Cyber Security, as well as expertise in Azure and AWS Cloud computing. 2. Prior to interviewing, candidates will take a test that poses questions related to: SIP Response Code, Aruba, EIGRP Internal Routes, Azure Services, AWS, AWS Design, VMware, FortiGate Identity, Webex Teams, XML Navigation , Cloud Solutions, and more. A score of 80% or higher will lead to an interview. Exam is 16 questions. Candidate should be able to complete in 56 min but they'll allow for 1hr and 24min 3. Good presentation skills.

title: Senior Manager, Mutual Fund Tax
description:
2077789-1

Job Description

The Role

The Senior Tax Manager is primarily responsible for performing detailed reviews of the workpapers for Regulated Investment Companies, including fiscal and excise tax provisions, annual financial statement disclosures, quarterly compliance tests, fund distribution calculations, 1120-RIC and Form 8613 tax returns, and shareholder year-end tax deliverables. In addition, as a Senior Tax Manager, you will share your knowledge with staff-level associates on securities taxation and complex derivatives including futures, swaps, and options. Additional responsibilities include working with our IT Development Squads to solution system enhancements and create operational efficiencies.

The Expertise And Skills You Bring

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or another business-related fieldCPA or MST desired7+ years of experience in mutual fund tax operations, or related tax-specialtyStrong knowledge of Subchapter M, and common RIC book-tax differencesBroad knowledge of accounting and tax principlesFamiliarity with tax research techniquesAbility to work in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented, team environmentStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to embrace and adapt to an ever-changing regulatory and technological environment


The Team

The Tax Team is part of the Fidelity Fund and Investment Operations (FFIO) business unit, which provides accounting and investment management support services to Fidelity businesses and mutual fund shareholders. The Tax team, along with the Shareholder Reporting Team, makes up the Fund Administration Group within FFIO. The primary responsibilities of the team include providing tax compliance services for US 40-Act mutual funds, Canadian mutual fund trusts, and alternative investment products. The Tax Team works closely with several different operations teams and internal business partners including Shareholder Reporting, Compliance, Legal, and Fund Treasury.

Certifications

Company Overview

Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.

Join Us

At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.

Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).

At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.

We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.

Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.

Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

title: Sr / Principal Product Manager, Business Model Strategy
description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

We are a small, highly leveraged team that defines monetization strategy for the entire company and this particular role will be passionate about opportunities within the Digital Experience business, centered around Experience Cloud. Our role is to influence the product roadmap to drive impact.

We do this by driving initiatives that optimize new and existing offerings via product configuration, product line determination, offer structure, and pricing. 

What You'll Do 

Develop and present recommendations that articulate the strategy and return on investment to acquire and incorporate cross-functional feedback and ultimately achieve executive approval. Work cross-functionally with PMM, PM, Sales, Ops, Sales, Finance, CPQ, and many other teams. Develop and conduct qualitative customer research and complete quantitative market research including one or more of the following research methods: Build-Your-Own Conjoint, Discrete Choice Conjoint, Gabor-Granger. Support the Enterprise Sales team with product sizing, custom pricing, and licensing needsCollection, synthesis, and analysis of industry and competitor data. Perform statistical analysis on empirical data (sales, usage, etc)Develop financial models that simulate customer behavior and project costs to complete scenario analysis that estimates the impact of the proposal on market penetration, company revenues, and margin. 

We also ensure the smooth execution of our proposals.

Define and drive product requirements for product roadmap and future releases to address customer needs related to the business model strategyPlan and coordinate operational activities required for execution. Set guidelines for direct sales, and develop sales plays, and training as appropriate. Complete post-mortems to ensure proposals are successful and/or refined. 

How do you succeed

We are looking for an analytical wiz with high initiative, a strategic approach, and quantitative talent.

MBA and/or 5+ Management/Strategy Consulting experience or Pricing/Packaging strategy experienceUnderstanding of Enterprise / b2b software sales processes – pricing, deal structures, discounting methodologiesThe ability to simplify the sophisticated, quickly define the core problem, and frame the solution approach. Attention to detail is balanced by solutions through ambiguity. Excellent deck-writing, communicating, and upward-influencing skills. Strong EQ, emotional maturity, and experience in driving consensus in a large matrixed organization are key requirements. 

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $146,800 -- $262,100 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. title: Assistant Digital Merchandiser
description:
Description

At Bath & Body Works, everyone belongs. We are committed to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture focused on delivering exceptional fragrances and experiences to our customers. We focus on recruiting, retaining, and advancing diverse talent where our associate population is as diverse as the communities we serve, live and work. In addition, we work to improve our communities and our planet in a way that will make us proud for years to come because we believe the world is a brighter, happier place when everyone has access to the things that make them happy.

The Assistant Digital Merchant Role at Bath & Body Works supports the execution of category and site strategies to grow their businesses on a consistent, profitable basis for Bath&BodyWorks.com. The Assistant Digital Merchant aids in the creation of these strategies and tactics by developing a deep understanding of the Direct business, Stores business, target customers and the competition.

Responsibilities

Works with Manager to develop clear strategies and tactics to drive volume, customer engagement and profit for respective categories on BBW.com.Actively analyze the business to provide significant insights into performance - assessing category, customer, and shopping behavior through the digital channel. Works together with Manager to develop seasonal plans that apply historical performance and current business data Supports seasonal digital floor-sets delivering upon brand, category, and customer priorities all while providing a streamlined shopping experiencePartner with Digital Commerce Operations to provide inputs for site builds and demonstrate new toolsets to drive category results.Responsible for the execution of launch plans and set-up for product category including, but not limited line list management, digital creative requests, pricing files Partner with Digital Marketing to provide category inputs to external marketing campaign strategiesLeads the approval of product launches on site validating all customer facing content (name, description, retail, imagery) Curiosity to move processes and workflows forward – drive efficiencies and speed to eliminate duplications and enhance agilityUnderstand the competition by conducting patterning activities to find opportunities and challenges for in-season business and future directionsVisits stores regularly to proactively solicit feedback from customers and sales associatesSeen as the category guide and "go to" person by their cross-functional partners Flexible to work during off-business hours to support BBW.com

Qualifications & Experience

1+ years of merchandising experience; ecommerce and/or buying experience preferred Understanding of vertically integrated retail, discernment, and retail math skillsProficient business insight in digital metricsSystems savvy (Adobe Analytics and Salesforce preferred); ecommerce content management systemsStrong communication and presentation skills (written & verbal) Balance of creativity and conceptual thinking with analytical and project management skillsFlexibility and agility in leading sophisticated projectsDemonstrates ability to collaborate with and influence cross-functional partners Detailed execution and anticipation of challenges, problem solving and follow throughSystems and computer proficiency (MS Office-Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel) 

Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience

Lead with Curiosity & HumilityBuild High Performing Teams for Today & TomorrowInfluence & Inspire with Vision & PurposeObserve, Engage & ConnectStrive to Achieve Operational ExcellenceDeliver Business Results

title: Chief Operating Officer
description:
Centura Wealth Advisory, a dynamic, registered investment advisory (RIA) firm serving both high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth individuals/families, is seeking an experienced professional to join our Executive Leadership team as the Chief Operating Officer. As the Chief Operating Officer, you will be a key member of our team helping to set strategic initiatives and trailblaze an unmatched culture.

The Chief Operating Officer is at the core of our internal vein and will have a large impact on a wide range of functions.

Operational Leadership

What You will Do: 

Provide strategic leadership and direction to all operational functions, including client service, compliance, finance, people & culture, and marketing.Develop and implement policies, procedures, and best practices to optimize operational efficiency, maximize productivity, and achieve business objectives.Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure and monitor operational performance and drive continuous improvement initiatives.

Strategic Planning And Execution

Collaborate with the CEO and leadership team to develop and implement strategic initiatives that support the company's mission, vision, and long-term goals.Lead the strategic planning process, conducting analysis, identifying opportunities, and defining priorities to drive sustainable growth and competitive advantage.Monitor industry trends, market dynamics, and regulatory developments to anticipate challenges and capitalize on emerging opportunities.

Financial Management

Oversee financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes to ensure sound financial management and alignment with strategic objectives.Monitor financial performance against budget and targets, analyze variances, and implement corrective actions as needed to optimize profitability and efficiency.Collaborate with finance and accounting teams to maintain financial controls, manage cash flow, and support investment decision-making.

Risk Management And Compliance

Establish and maintain a comprehensive risk management framework to identify, assess, and mitigate operational, regulatory, and reputational risks.Ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards governing Registered Investment Advisors (RIAs), including SEC requirements.Oversee the implementation of compliance policies, procedures, and training programs to promote a culture of compliance and integrity throughout the organization.

Leadership And Team Development

Build and develop a high-performance team by recruiting, training, and retaining top talent, and fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and accountability.Provide mentorship, guidance, and coaching to direct reports and team members, empowering them to achieve their full potential and contribute to organizational success.Lead by example, demonstrating ethical leadership, professionalism, and a commitment to excellence in all aspects of operations and decision-making.

What We Look for: 

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.Proven experience (10 years) in executive leadership roles within the financial services industry, with a focus on Registered Investment Advisors (RIAs) highly desirable.Strong understanding of financial markets, investment products, and regulatory requirements governing RIAs, including SEC regulations and fiduciary standards.Exceptional leadership abilities with a track record of driving operational excellence, strategic planning, and organizational transformation.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to influence and inspire stakeholders at all levels of the organization.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think strategically, make data-driven decisions, and drive results in a dynamic and competitive environment.

What ‘s In It For You?

title: Substation Welder
description:
Overview

Energy Erectors, Inc. (EEI) tackles terrain, technology, and timelines to construct transmission line projects up to 500 kV and has over 30 years of experience building substations and switchyards. With integrated in-house construction, engineering, procurement, and commissioning capabilities, Energy Erectors has the experience and resources to deliver world-class solutions to complex power transmission and distribution projects. Areas of expertise include GIS and VAR compensators. EEI’s mission is to safely deliver the highest quality work, exceed client expectations, and relentlessly maintain a reputation for integrity.

Energy Erectors is a purpose-driven company. Our core values guide our strategy, performance, and culture. We believe in maintaining an environment where team members can make an impact, grow, and thrive. A place where they find meaning and purpose in doing the important work of ensuring communities have the vital energy, light, and communications to prosper. Our culture is inclusive and welcoming. Our teams are empowered with abundant training, tools, and opportunities to follow their curiosity and ambitions. Everyone has an equal chance to advance. Everyone is supported, respected, and challenged to be their best. We’re always looking for talented and dedicated people to join us and love where they work.

Energy Erectors is a proud subsidiary of MasTec (NYSE: MTZ), a Fortune 500 Company ranked by Energy News-Record as one of the leading contractors in the country. EEI is part of the MasTec Power Delivery segment. We are certified as a minority-controlled company by the National Minority Suppliers Development Council (NMSDC). Our rich diversity of people and ideas makes us a stronger, more innovative organization.

Job Summary

The Substation Technician maintains and preforms repairs, modifications, replacements and installation of a wide variety of electrical and electronic equipment systems while adhering to EEI’s Safety First Culture.

This role supports the construction of new Substations as well as modifications, and upgrades of existing Substations for Electrical Utility Companies throughout Florida. This is a traveling role that requires working in different job sites. Per diem is provided when applicable.

Responsibilities

Work safely while assisting in new/existing construction and various tasks such as:DemolitionSite preparationExcavatingBackfillingLandscapingTrenchingPole settingCable labelingRead and understand system maps to become knowledgeable in general electric distribution system layout, system substation capacities and load areas, substation circuit feeds, and general system sectionalizing.Assist with installing transformer and transformer banks, bus structures and switchgear, lines (underground/overhead), ground grid, control buildings, and other related substation material tasks.Able to operate forklifts and maintain a valid forklift certification.Will work with man baskets, skid steers, shovels, compactors, back hoes and other industry equipment.Frequently work around energized high voltage systems requiring skill and care.Understands and complies with the Company’s Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.Other duties as assigned by Management.
Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications

Obtain and maintain a valid State Class C driver’s license.Must have previous substation experience Must be willing to travel around Florida.

Preferred Qualifications

OSHA 10.4+ years of substation experince 

Physical Demands and Work Environment

This job operates in a field environment. This role routinely requires extended periods of bending, squatting, climbing, kneeling, pushing, pulling, lifting, lifting in awkward positions, standing, and twisting. Also, working in inclement weather conditions, such as extreme heat, extreme cold, rain, ice, snow, and wind.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. This position is physically active, with lifting required. Must be able to bend and lift and carry up to 50 pounds. Clarity of vision at 20 feet or more or 20 inches or less, with the ability to judge distance and space relationships. Precise hand-eye coordination. Ability to identify and distinguish colors.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive list of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. The Company reserves the right to revise or change the job duties as the need arises. Management reserves the right to change the description, duties, or work schedules to accommodate individuals with disabilities. 

Benefits available include Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life insurance, a 401k plan and Employee Stock Purchase plan. MasTec is a publicly traded company MTZ (NYSE).

Equal Employment Opportunity

The Company’s policy is not to unlawfully discriminate against any applicant or employee based on race, color, national origin, ethnicity, sex, gender, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law and EEOC regulations. The Company also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories.

Wear appropriate special safety equipment.Climb heights up to 24 feet to gauge tanks.Walk, bend, stoop, lift, push, and pull.Use hand tools to make minor repairs.Work weekends and be on call.

title: Account Executive
description:
Account Executive
We are seeking a highly motivated and results-driven Account Executive to join our esteemed COA (Clinical Outcome Assessment) team at Lionbridge. In this critical role, you will be responsible for proactively and independently engaging with existing customers to maintain, develop and grow new relationships and revenue streams across your portfolio of assigned accounts.Your primary focus will be on growth, through strategically positioning and selling Lionbridge as a preferred provider of COA and eCOA language and localization solutions. Your efforts will be evidenced in your ability to conduct thorough needs assessments drawing on your deep COA expertise, maintaining a robust and up-to-date pipeline, and identifying upsell opportunities to drive revenue growth. Collaboration with internal and external stakeholders will be essential to foster strong relationships and deliver exceptional customer service. The successful candidate will demonstrate a strong understanding of industry and client needs in the clinical trials and clinical outcomes domain, will have effective communication skills, and importantly, will be able to show a proven track record of meeting/exceeding revenue targets selling into this area of clinical trial support.

What You Will Do:Independently manage and develop customers and contacts within assigned COA/eCOA accounts as well as Lionbridge’s client base of pharma sponsors to present Lionbridge's solutions and services, effectively articulating the value proposition.Maintain a robust and up-to-date pipeline, identifying and pursuing existing and upsell opportunities to achieve set revenue quotas within the COA sector.Understand client requirements by conducting thorough needs assessments, ensuring a tailored approach to presenting solutions that meet specific needs and challenges.Educate customers and clients on Lionbridge's service lines, solutions, pricing, and availability, consistently exceeding revenue targets.Cultivate and nurture strong relationships with stakeholders (internal and external), maintaining regular communication to address inquiries and provide updates.Provide regular updates and reports on sales activities, pipeline status, and performance metrics to management, contributing to overall sales strategy and planning.Stay informed about industry trends and developments within the clinical outcome assessment sector, incorporating market insights into sales strategies.Act as a trusted advisor to clients, providing expert guidance and support throughout the sales process to ensure customer satisfaction and retention.

To Be Successful You Will Have:Industry Knowledge: A sound understanding of the pharmaceutical and biotech industry, particularly clinical trial operations, regulatory requirements, and the importance of clinical outcome assessments (COAs) in drug development.Language Services Expertise: Experience in selling language solutions such as translation, interpretation, localization, and linguistic validation services tailored to the needs of clinical trial operations and COA support.Familiarity with COA Tools and Instruments: Proficiency in COA tools and instruments commonly used in clinical trials, such as patient-reported outcomes (PROs), clinician-reported outcomes (ClinROs), observer-reported outcomes (ObsROs), and performance outcome measures (PerfOs).Consultative Selling Skills: Ability to understand the unique challenges and requirements of clinical trial sponsors, CROs (Contract Research Organizations), and other stakeholders involved in COA implementation, and offer tailored language solutions to address their needs.Relationship Building: Strong interpersonal skills and a proven track record of building and maintaining relationships with key decision-makers and influencers in the clinical trial industry, including clinical operations managers, regulatory affairs professionals, and medical directors.Results-Oriented Approach: Demonstrated success in achieving sales targets, driving revenue growth, and expanding market share within the language services segment of the clinical trial industry.Communication and Presentation Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to articulate complex language solutions and COA support services in a clear, compelling manner to diverse audiences.Adaptability and Innovation: Willingness to stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and regulatory changes affecting clinical outcome assessment requirements, and proactively identify innovative solutions to meet evolving client needs.Project Management Skills: Ability to collaborate effectively with internal teams (e.g., project managers, linguists, quality assurance specialists) to ensure successful execution and delivery of language services projects within the clinical trial space.

In Return, You Can ExpectOngoing career opportunities at a repeat Forbes and Newsweek-listed “Best Employer for Women”, “Best Employer for Diversity”, “Best Remote Employer”, “Best Large Employer”, and “Most Loved Workplace”Career development and a career path designed to utilize your learned skills and ultimate professional passions in a world-leading company with over 25 years of world-leading experience

Our People are Our Pride – Benefits and PerksCompetitive pay based on the work you’ll do here and not your previous salary. Expected Compensation: $100-$110k/year base + a competitive and achievable commission plan! Health Coverage for you and your family with multiple plan options: Health, Vision, Dental; as well as HSA and FSA eligible programsGenerous Paid-Time-Off and 10 Company Paid Holidays, as well as Floating Holidays, Paid Volunteer Days and an additional Paid Day Off for your Birthday!401k with company matchFree access to Lionbridge’s Employee Wellness Platform and Employee Assistance Program to support both physical and mental healthEarn extra money in your HSA for completing Wellness Incentive goals through employer contributionsCareer guidance with learning and development opportunities along the way, backed by Lionbridge’s Internal Mobility and Referral Bonus programs

For over 25 years, we have helped companies connect with their global customers and employees by delivering translation and localization solutions in 350+ languages. Through our world-class platform, we orchestrate a network of passionate experts across the globe who partner with brands to create culturally rich experiences. Relentless in our love of linguistics, we use the best of human and machine intelligence to forge understanding that resonates with our customers’ clients. title: Principal, Real Assets
description:
2091133

Job Description

The Role

Devonshire Investors is a private investment firm affiliated with FMR LLC, the parent company of Fidelity Investments. Headquartered in Boston, Devonshire manages investments on behalf of FMR and its shareholders in businesses outside of the financial services industry.

Devonshire invests in directly-held real estate, venture capital and later-stage private equity. Devonshire actively participates in its direct investments, while leveraging expertise across a global platform in the United States, Europe and Asia. The portfolio targets the real assets, technology and life sciences sectors. Devonshire has over $20 billion in assets under management.

The Real Assets platform consists of holdings in natural resources, real estate, telecommunications and infrastructure. The platform comprises direct investments, wholly-owned operating companies, dedicated vehicles for minority equity investments, and very limited fund investments.

This position will report to the Head of Real Assets. The platform consists of dozens of direct real assets investments and the platform continues to grow. As a result of this growth, Devonshire is adding this new position. Primary responsibilities will include: supporting oversight of existing portfolio holdings, supporting diligence of new investments, conducting industry research and analysis, developing, testing and refining real asset investment thesis and supporting investor communication and investment performance review (with analyst support).

The Expertise And Skills You Bring

Partner with investment and operations teams on portfolio management and oversight of existing holdingsServe as board member, board committee member and/or investor representative for individual holdings alongside investment team members; develop strong working relationships with management teams, fellow board members and investment partnersDrive favorable investment outcomes. Certifications

Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.

Join Us

At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.

Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).

At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.

We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.

Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.

Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

title: Business Operations Manager
description:
Telesat Government Solutions (TGS) is a wholly owned subsidiary based in Arlington, VA with responsibility to take all of Telesat’s products to US and foreign Government customers, to devise solutions to fit user community requirements, to ensure that Telesat’s products are fit-for-purpose, and to prepare a scalable organization to meet the needs of delivering on Lightspeed’s promised service levels.

TGS is seeking a Business Operations Manager/Assistant Facility Security Officer to help manage the operations of our growing office in Arlington, Virginia including Financial and Accounting operations, Office and Facilities Administration, IT and Security Infrastructure Administration, facilitation and management of Contract Support, Marketing & Sales Support, HR administration, and administrative support to staff and President.

Role Responsibilities (Financial And Accounting Operations)

Coordinate with TGS’s Managed Accounting Services (MAS) provider the monthly accounting processing, including vendor management, accounts payable and receivable, banking, purchasing, procurement, billing, customer management and processing, General Ledger management and financial reporting. Work with company managers to provide feedback on how to improve overall financial performance. Perform due diligence on new vendors and coordinate review and approval of invoice activities with applicable staff and management. Perform billing of government customers using such federal procurement sites as Wide Area Workflow (WAWF) and Procurement Integrated Enterprise Environment (PIEE) and other required billing interfacesReview bank activities and ensure monthly banking reconciliations are performed (in coordination with MAS)Oversee bank accounts and generate cash transactions and transfers. Review, administer and reconcile corporate credit cards. Ensure time and expense compliance including staff daily entry of time and bi-weekly management approvals. Assist with cash flow forecasting to support internal cash requirements. Reconcile recorded billing hours by staff and invoice customers. Coordinate intercompany charging and service order agreements with staff, President, and corporate. Support budgeting for revenues, expenses, and capital expenditures in coordination with staff, President and corporate. Track actual expenditures and expenses vs. budgeted projections and advise management on corrective actions including cost reallocation to restore budget levels as appropriate. Support TGS’s Financial Advisor/CFO, President and the Board in financial analysis, planning and financial management. Manage travel and expense (T&E) processing and approval process (via Deltek Costpoint® Time and Expense) and ensure compliance with approved T&E policies. Manage third-party processing and filing of annual and quarterly tax returns, VA taxes, and corporate registration fees and renewals. Work with company managers to provide feedback on how to improve overall financial performance. 

Role Responsibilities (Contract Support)

Support the execution of administrative modifications to existing contracts. Support file maintenance. Perform data entry and retrieval in contracts and financial database to support contract administration. Maintain accurate records of invoices and contracts. Ensure compliance with procurement policies and procedures. Conducting market research and negotiating pricing

Role Responsibilities (Office And Facilities Administration)

Manage vendor relations and negotiate pricing and terms and conditions for office operations including building property management, phone and utilities, housekeeping, secure room, video equipment upgrades and other infrastructure improvements, office and kitchen supplies and general office maintenance. Coordinate and support board meetings and provide administrative support to board members such as travel arrangements and lodging. Process travel expense reports and other related travel documents. Coordinate domestic and international travel. Support group travel to offsite retreats and other similar events. Executive administration support to the President in office administration time management, staff meetings, TGS contract approval, President and Board approvalsMeeting and event planning and implementation (catering, set-up, office presentations and exhibits)Manage (in coordination with IT and Security) staff resources including IT infrastructure. Monitor compliance with Federal, State, Local and DoD policies such as signage, occupational safety, emergency medical equipment (AED Defibrillator)Liaise with the Board of Directors members. Assist with drafting ad-hoc and regular communications. Complete, as needed, all Government-mandated training. Ensure compliance with Facility Clearance (FCL) Government regulations. 

Role Responsibilities (Marketing & Sales Support)

Support preparation and distribution of TGS brochures, marketing and sales promotional materials, web site, industry conference and trade show registrations, attendance, and travel planning. Coordinate with corporate for collateral support and coordinate specific office and regional marketing materials in line with marketing plans. Coordinate and participate in promotional activities, conferences and demonstrations to market products and services (set-up/breakdown and support booth activities)Monitor, review and distribute web inquiries. 

Role Responsibilities (HR Administration)

Support and implement HR training, performance management, and compliance. Administer and manage employee compliance training in coordination with third-party provider NAVEX. Ensure and maintain that all employee information is confidential and securely stored digitally. Coordinate onboarding of new employee training and development, orientation of office and personnel dataOrganizational department planningAdminister the time management operations including leave requests, PTO, and business travel. 

Role Responsibilities (IT And Security Infrastructure Administration)

Administrator for GCC High licenses and billing in coordination with C3 Integrated SolutionsProvide program support for CMMC certification. Lead administrator for accessing and maintaining employee and third-party login access to Deltek Costpoint®, and NAVEX GlobalManage information technology (IT) and computer systems in compliance with application U.S. Government requirements. 

Required Skills & Qualifications

5+ years - finance and accounting; office and facilities management, IT management; HR administrator, marketing administratorThis position supports U.S. national security contracts and requires a clearance. Eligible candidates must be a U.S. citizen clearable to Secret; a polygraph examination may be required. The ideal candidate has an active Secret level clearance or adjudicated eligibility. Experience working in a small to medium sized government contracting office environment with excellent time management skills, and the ability to multi-task and prioritize work. Experience managing financial operations and reporting. Experience with bookkeeping and accounting practices, including cost accounting and cost reimbursement contracts. Experience with service-based contract accounting practices for the federal government. Experience with government invoicing systems for contractors (WAWF, Treasury IPP, etc.)Monitoring of accounts receivables and invoicing, accounts payable and payments, and cashflow trackingManagement and execution of commercial supply and services purchases and service contracts

At Telesat Government Services, we take pride in being an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. Qualified applicants will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, color, religion, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, national origin, protected veteran status, physical disability, medical condition, mental disability, or disability status and any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. We are committed to providing the best candidate experience possible including any required accommodations at every stage of our interview process.

All qualified applicants that have been selected for an interview that require accommodations, are advised to inform the Telesat Talent team accordingly. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential.

title: Profee Coding Auditor
description:
Elevate your expertise! Join UASI today and work with the top HIM experts in the industry. The remote coding and auditing positions at UASI allow HIM professionals to have the best of both worlds: a challenging opportunity to utilize and enhance current coding skills and the convenience of working from home.

We are currently seeking an experienced Coding Auditor to join our team working remotely from a home office. Responsibilities include:

Perform coding audits and reviews on a variety of professional fee record types including: Evaluation and Management, surgical CPT, hospitalist, annual well visits, inpatient pro-fee and outpatient pro-fee.Perform coding audits and reviews on a variety of specialties, such as: Primary Care, ENT, Nephrology, Urology, Cardiology, Thoracic, Neurology, Emergency Department, Obstetrics and Gynecology, Behavioral Health, Ophthalmology, Endocrinology etc. Perform necessary research in order to provide the client with supportive regulatory and coding guideline documentation. Examples of this research include but is not limited to: Official Coding Guidelines, Medicare/Medicaid Claims Processing Manual, Office of Inspector General guidance, Local/National coverage determinations and transmittals, and National Correct Coding InitiativesAssist in the design and presentation of educational seminars to clients and staff.Work with other members of the HIM Consulting Division on Senior Level Projects such as assessment and analysis, development of tools to assist in the audit process, development of education for staff, develop coding test material for applicants and develop coding content for short articles with coding advice for clients.

The ideal candidate will be flexible, detail-oriented, have the ability to work independently, quality conscious and be able to adapt well to change. Additional qualifications include:

AHIMA or AAPC certification.2-3 years’ minimum experience performing E/M audits and reviews in addition to previous coding experience.The ability to remain impartial and objective in finalizing and presenting audit findings.Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate with confidence on site and via webinar/conference calls.

UASI is dedicated to providing employees with the tools needed for professional growth and development. We also recognize that HIM professionals are our greatest asset and in return for your talents, we offer a dynamic work environment, career growth and development, strong leadership, full benefits and competitive pay.
